name: Garibaldi House Inn & Suites

reviews.text: This little hotel is charming and comfortable and the owners are friendly and work hard to create an enjoyable atmosphere. The free breakfast and snacks in the evening were great. The rooms were comfortable, clean and nice. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would high recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Charming and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here the weekend before Halloween. When we arrived Friday night, there was no one to be found! I banged on the bell several times, walked up and down the hall next to the offices - nothing. Finally, an older gentleman came down the elevator (I think he was the owner) and asked if I was being helped? "No!", said I. He ran some girl down and we finally got checked in. We got stuck in the same room next to the laundry that someone else mentioned here. We should have asked for a top floor room, but I never think of those things until it is too late. Then, when we were leaving on Sunday at 11am, check out time, again, no one to be found. I finally just left my keys on the desk and drove off. :(
reviews.title: Light on staff during off season

reviews.text: But, as mentioned, the amenities are nice. The breakfast is typical for an economy hotel, I mean, I've had the same at places like La Quinta. The happy hour snacks are nice, but pulled pork doesn't work for vegetarians. ;)
reviews.title: Magical hotel with class

reviews.text: Really, I thought it was just average. Rooms and bathroom were clean, beds okay. Oh, the sink was in the main room and not the bathroom, which was a little weird.
reviews.title: Road Truip America

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lovely boutique hotel in Garibaldi OR was recommended by my fishing guide but it was anything but a fishing shack. The owners, Carol and Gene, have completely refurbished an old Comfort Inn into a classy destination you'll want to return to as soon as possible. It's a small, boxy 3-story motel on the outside, but once you walk through the front doors a new experience emerges. The front desk employees are welcoming and friendly, a cozy fire is burning, and wonderful afternoon snacks of summer sausage, local cheeses, Gene's world famous clam chowder, tasty crackers, cookies, popcorn and salt water taffy are beautifully presented for your enjoyment as you settle into comfortable leather couches. Daily local newspapers are scattered about to keep you up to date with the news. The paint is fresh and the windows are clean. It smells like home, if your home is immaculate. Your room is fresh with comfortable beds and cozy linens, the bathroom is sparkling with a good showerhead, clean tub, sanitized toilet, and spa-grade cosmetics and soaps are provided. Breakfast is served starting at 5:00 am, a great convenience for fishermen or travelers wanting an early start, and is a complete buffet featuring a couple of types of real scrambled eggs, link sausages, potatoes, waffles, pork sausage gravy and what appeared to be home baked biscuits, mini-muffins, pastries, breads, juice, assorted cereals and, of course, delicious coffee that always seems freshly brewed. Carol and Gene are always around, cheerful and attentive, and wanting to make the hotel as pleasant as possible. Carol even tries to bribe you with wonderful chocolates, something quite unnecessary but extremely welcome. The rates are a bargain too! Don't miss this wonderful location.
reviews.title: Garibaldi's Inn is super!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We purchased a two night package through Living Social. The hotel is very clean and the staff is quite friendly. Very accommodating. The hot breakfast offered in the morning is fantastic - my husband was all over it.
reviews.title: Friendly & Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable and clean. The bed was a bit uncomfortable though. I kind of sank into my side while my husband's side of the bed was firmer. The sound on our TV was awful. It was stuck on "surround" with no way to change it. If there was background noise in a movie or TV show, you couldn't hear the actors speaking. It was very odd. Not a big issue, but if it had been raining and we were indoors more, it would have become a bigger issue.
reviews.title: Excellent all around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was next to the elevator, vending machine room and laundry room (they have laundry facilities available to guests - at a charge - but what a nice feature for those on road trips). It was a tad noisy being next to all these high traffic and noise generating machines, but the noise never went on for long. I kind of wondered if we were placed here because we were on a Living Social package.
reviews.title: Warm Welcome

reviews.text: Not much to do in the town of Garibaldi, but that was okay. We were up and down the Coast like crazy people checking out little towns, beaches, antique stores, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent staff, service & stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The happy hour snacks they offer are also a wonderful treat. We highly recommend this property.
reviews.title: BEST KEPT SECRET
Comfortable surroundings, welcoming staff.
reviews.text: We stayed two nights, having purchased a Living Social package. The room itself was simple, standard, and comfortable -- but what really made the experience was the friendliness of the staff and the attention to detail. Our package included a rose and chocolates, which was a lovely personal touch to see in the room, first thing, when we arrived. Snacks are available in the lobby, and the hot breakfast buffet was a wonderful option to have. Both mornings, the chef checked in with us to see if we needed anything else. It's not a standard continental breakfast -- loved the mango salsa! The front desk staff was helpful and accomodating with dinner suggestions, the pool and jacuzzi area was clean and pleasant, and a fire going in the lobby fireplace really sets a wonderful tone. And it's such a small thing, but wireless is always appreciated!

reviews.title: Not what i expected
reviews.text: The drive to Cannon Beach from here is lovely -- because Garibaldi isn't as busy, we enjoyed the calm and the quiet and I would certainly stay here again.

reviews.title: A Wonderful Surprise
reviews.text: I purchased a Living Social deal for this hotel. It was advertized as romance package for 1/2 price for 2 nights at $175. Thus I expected a hotel that cost $350 for 2 nights. After our stay I checked and it was $90/night, so that was misleading. I also expected something "romanitc" since it was marketed as a "romance package". They put us in a standard room that overlooked the outdoor smoking section and firehouse. There were kids in the room above us jumping on the bed all evening until I asked the front desk to contact them. The acoustics in the pool made it horribly loud with the kids and the hot tub was in the same room, so not relaxing. The sauna was a nice addition but it was tiny.

reviews.title: Better than expected
reviews.text: The scenic photos on their website are not visible from the hotel. The marina that we could walk to was a fishing base so not the picturesque marina that one strolls through.

reviews.title: Another great weekend at the Garibaldi House
reviews.text: I will say the breakfast was amazing. And the evening snacks were a nice addition. But the marketing on the Living Social deal was very misleading. I would never have spent $175 for 2 nights had I known what I was getting. I wouldn't even have spent the $89 for 1 night, to get away to the coast.

reviews.title: Another great stay at the Garibaldi House!
reviews.text: We had another great stay at this hotel during the weekend after Thanksgiving. The hotel is decorated beautifully for the holidays. It's quite spectacular when you walk into the lobby at night. They served excellent clam chowder for happy hour for our first night and great little sliders the second night. Our son was able to burn off some energy in the pool, as always.

reviews.title: Great Garibaldi
reviews.text: As for the local area, we tried something new and ventured up 101 a bit to the town of Wheeler. We found a huge antique store that kept us occupied for over an hour. We lucked out with the weather and enjoyed 60 degree days the whole weekend, which made it easy to walk on the beach, stroll around Rockaway, and watch the fishing from the Garibaldi pier. I think the Oregon coast during winter is the best kept secret - prices are low, the weather is good, and it's no too crowded. We'll be heading back again after the holidays.

reviews.title: Small touches mean a lot!
reviews.text: The service and amenities in the form of food were amazing. We should have checked in before going to dinner-we would have not needed to go to dinner. The hotel has homemade clam chowder, sausage, cheese, fresh cold cucumber water, chocolates, and yummy taffy. Popcorn was available 24 hours. The room was clean. The bathroom sink was actually in the room so you lost your privacy when brushing your teeth or washing your face. The rooms had free wifi. Four people in a room is a little snug but doable. The hotel has a nice elevator with a view of the lobby. The breakfast was good-2 kinds of eggs-plain and with bacon, Puerto rican potatoes, cereal, make your own waffles, juice. The coffee was mediocre-not for the coffee snobs. Great location if wine tasting in the area. Restaurants not far away in Tillamook. I would stay again.

reviews.title: great service
reviews.text: We stayed here for Thanksgiving weekend (arriving late Friday night and leaving Monday morning). The staff was always very friendly. When having breakfast I was asked if there was anything else they could get for me a couple of different times. The breakfast itself was wonderful and they had it out from 5-10 am, early enough for those full days and late enough for days we wanted to sleep in. There was popcorn and salami and cheese platter for the evening snacks and coffee, juice, and some salt water taffy out all the time. Our only problem with the shower temperature and we didn't bring it up to them until we were leaving so they didn't have a chance to fix it while we were there (we were just too busy). I'm willing to bet that maintenance was there asap after we left to figure out the problem.

reviews.title: Fall Fling Round Dance Weekend
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights on a package deal. While the area where the hotel is located is not exactly scenic, the service at the hotel was beyond good. Each member of the team of employees went above and beyond to make one feel welcomed. The snacks, which were more like mini meals, were a special treat as was the breakfast each morning. There was a small but pleasant indoor spa and pool as well as a pleasant lobby. The rooms are pretty typical hotel rooms but clean and comfortable. Beds were comfortable but they could do better with their pillows. There is no view to speak of and we found it necessary to drive to find a beach area for walking. Overall, it was a pleasant stay but don't count on it being a place to watch the winter storms or have a view of the ocean.

description: Located just minutes from the Pacific Ocean--and miles and miles of magnificent coastal beaches--the Garibaldi House 50-room hotel is perfect for family vacations and weekend getaways.At the Garibaldi House, we do more than rent rooms--we want our guests to enjoy a true Oregon Coast-style hospitality experience. That means making sure you enjoy a comfortable stay with the conveniences of a modern hotel, but with the friendly atmosphere of a small bed and breakfast.And in Garibaldi, centrally located at the north end of Tillamook bay near the mouth, the air is as fresh as the ocean and forests that surround it.
